hackathon-description-text: We're bringing together Ethereum enthusiasts and students to contribute to the Ethereum ecosystem by solving real life problems utilizing smart contracts and developing the infrastructure needed to help build our decentralized future. This hackathon is an opportunity for bright inquisitive students interested in blockchain technology to work alongside established leaders, developers, and companies who have dedicated themselves to bringing about the next technological revolution.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: The three projects that the judges score as having best fit our criteria will win 2 ETH each
The 2 runner-up projects will receive 1 ETH each.

Corl is a royalty financing company that leverages data and technology to streamline the startup fundraising process. The long-term objective of the company is to use technology to decentralize, automate, and secure the startup fundraising process. Read the whitepaper at corl.io/whitepaper and build:
In a blockchain enabled world how can two people resolve a transactional dispute when there is no one in the middle to help judge or arbitrate?
Best project that innovates Initial Coin Offerings/Security Token Offerings or streamlines the process of verifying KYC/AML and accreditation statuses of investors.

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=40 St George St, Toronto, ON M5S 2E4, Canada

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Can this DApp be turned into an actual business or open-source project after the hackathon?
